Braedon Cunningham

In the first two weeks of school, he has shown up for more voluntary lessons than anyone else, and has a clear goal in mind of what he would like to accomplish with his instrument. He has already impressed the student leaders and myself with his commitment and willingness to learn.

Congratulations Braedon!

Congratulations to Eli Houdyshell, Levi McKinley, Jacob Larson, and Isiah Hand for being chosen as Pierre Fine Arts-First National Bank “Performers of the Week!” Here are their nominations:

Eli Houdyshell, Levi McKinley, Jacob Larson, Isiah Hand (Choir): These four gentlemen took a barbershop quartet to our small group contest a few weeks ago. Barbershop quartets are not often seen at contest as the music and style is very difficult. The four parts create very tight chords that need to be in tune, and they really test part independence. From the moment they were given their piece, they were excited about it and they were always practicing it to get it down. After learning it, they took it upon themselves to dress the part, and add in a little act or schtick for their piece. They received a Superior with a perfect score and performed to a packed room. They were an absolute hit.

Pierre Players Community Theatre
February 9 at 12:26 PM ·

Pierre Players Community Theatre offers a post secondary scholarship. Funds to support the scholarships are provided by concession sales during Pierre Players productions. Awarded scholarships will be a minimum of $500, with the number of scholarships awarded each year dependent on funds available.

The scholarship is based on participation in fine arts programs, activities and events. Pierre Players Community Theatre participation is given preference. Scholarship awards will be disbursed directly to scholarship winners. Winners will be announced at the end of April.

Applicants must be currently enrolled in high school or higher education. Applicants may apply their senior year of high school and reapply each year as they complete their post-secondary education. Application must be completed in full and returned to Pierre Players by March 31, 2020.

Congratulations to Naomi McCarthy, Laney Voigt, Violet Gardner, and Liam Kelly for being chosen as Pierre Fine Arts-First National Bank “Performers of the Week!” Here is their nomination:

Naomi McCarthy, Laney Voigt, Violet Gardner, Liam Kelly are rising culinary art stars who have spent two early Saturday mornings mentoring adult community members through the CUC Osher Lifelong Learning Institute (OLLI). In October, they taught basic knife skills and some Asian cuisine including pork pot stickers, Vietnamese fresh vegetable spring rolls and lettuce wraps. This month, they mentored their adult bakers through the 10 Steps of Bread Making and helped teach community members to master the batard loaf, boule loaf, cinnamon rolls, and focaccia in a mere three hours. These students not only gave up two precious Saturdays but came in with so much excitement and professionalism that made these adult classes a magical and memorable experience for the OLLI members.
